column4: Hi, I installed hoary today and updated the packages. After the update (I think) the boot crashes unless i edit the boot with acpi=off
any tips on what might have caused this?
do you have an acpi computer?
acpi is for powermanagment right? Anyway, I noticed this when I rebooted when I installed the fglrx driver. The shutdown process froze on the acpi stuff
your laptop may have non standard acpi for some reason... try googling, if you haven't already
changes to acpi may have mucked stuff up that in that regard
I'm not sure what you mean? changes when I updated?
run nautilus --browser and it should appear in the left pane
just dmesg, you want the very end of it
you're going to need to mount /dev/sdb1 as an auto filesystem
